revenue.notes: Proff reports 2024 operating revenue as 7 373 145 with amounts stated in thousands, giving NOK 7 373 145 000 after conversion [1].

company.entity_resolution_notes: The Proff record used is a site page (AVD PORSGRUNN) but it explicitly points to “Hovedenhet ERAMET NORWAY AS” with org. no. 980 518 647; Brønnøysund confirms ERAMET NORWAY AS with the same organisation number [1][2].

srm_assessment.overall_summary: Eramet Norway shows evidence of inbound secondary inputs through internal recirculation of metallurgical by-products: ferromanganese slag is used as raw material for silicomanganese production, and furnace dust/slag are reintroduced into production processes [3][4][5]. Evidence indicates meaningful operational use, but no disclosed annual inbound SRM tonnage [3][4][5].

srm_inputs.label: Internal recirculation of ferromanganese slag and furnace dust
srm_inputs.used_for: Ferromanganese slag is used as an input in silicomanganese production in Kvinesdal, and furnace dust/slag are reintroduced into production processes [3][4][5].
srm_inputs.tier_reasoning: Company and group disclosures describe slag as an “important input factor” and state that large quantities of by-products are internally circulated/reintroduced, indicating ongoing meaningful use rather than isolated pilots [4][5].
srm_inputs.volume_notes: No direct annual mass/energy quantity for inbound recirculated slag or furnace dust is disclosed in the reviewed public sources [3][4][5].
srm_inputs.uncertainties: Available disclosures are qualitative and do not separate exact inbound SRM volumes by site/year; therefore tiering is based on wording about operational importance and internal circulation [4][5].

gaps_and_uncertainties: Public sources reviewed do not provide a numeric annual inbound quantity (t/year) for recirculated FeMn slag or furnace dust [3][4][5].
Disclosures mix site-level and company-level narratives, limiting precise allocation of SRM input volumes to legal-entity totals [4][5].
